page.title: 16Recreation
page.content: There are 5 playing fields and public parks in the area,plus an 18-hole golf course,with a membership of 400. The Lochore Meadows Country Park provides facilities for water-sports, walking,golf,fishing and with the ever increasing return of birds and mammals to the area,naturalists will have much to interest them.5 Park Rangers work full-time to assist visitors and run the "Peewit Club" especially for children. During the year 1984-'85, 145,000 visitors used the Park Centre;Anglers numbered 7,650;the Golf Course was used by 7,000 golfers. For those interested in indoor pursuits the Lochgelly Centre caters for all age ranges in archery,bowling, gymnastics,pottery,dancing,film-making ,martial arts,theatre workshops,music making and all ball games. {(ctd.)
